com.maxleap

Class MLQueryManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.maxleap.MLQueryManager

  • public final class MLQueryManager
extends Object
    * This class provides the ability to manage the MLQuery.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • countInBackground

        public static void countInBackground(MLQuery<? extends MLObject> query,
                                     CountCallback callback)
        Counts the number of objects that match this query in a background thread.
        Parameters:
        query - the query
        callback - callback.internalDone(count, e) will be called when the count completes.

      • getFirstInBackground

        public static <T extends MLObject> void getFirstInBackground(MLQuery<T> query,
                                                             GetCallback<T> callback)
        Retrieves at most one MLObject that satisfies this query from the server in a background thread.
        Type Parameters:
        T - a class extends MLObject
        Parameters:
        query - the query
        callback - callback.internalDone(object, e) is called when the find completes.

      • findAllInBackground

        public static <T extends MLObject> void findAllInBackground(MLQuery<T> query,
                                                            FindCallback<T> callback)
        Retrieves a list of MLObjects that satisfy this query from the server in a background thread.
        Type Parameters:
        T - a class extends MLObject
        Parameters:
        query - the query
        callback - callback.internalDone(objectList, e) is called when the find completes.

      • getInBackground

        public static <T extends MLObject> void getInBackground(Class<T> subclass,
                                                        String objectId,
                                                        GetCallback<T> callback)
        Constructs a MLObject whose id is already known by fetching data from the server in a background thread. This does not use caching. This is preferable to using the MLObject(className, objectId) constructor, unless your code is already running in a background thread.
        Type Parameters:
        T - a class extends MLObject
        Parameters:
        subclass - The class of object to create.
        objectId - Object id of the MLObject to fetch.
        callback - callback.done(object, e) will be called when the fetch completes.

      • getInBackground

        public static <T extends MLObject> void getInBackground(MLQuery<T> query,
                                                        String objectId,
                                                        GetCallback<T> callback)
        Constructs a MLObject whose id is already known by fetching data from the server in a background thread. This does not use caching. This is preferable to using the MLObject(className, objectId) constructor, unless your code is already running in a background thread.
        Type Parameters:
        T - a class extends MLObject
        Parameters:
        query - the query
        objectId - the object id for search
        callback - callback.done(object, e) will be called when the fetch completes.

      • getInBackground

        public static <T extends MLObject> MLObject getInBackground(String className,
                                                            String objectId,
                                                            GetCallback<T> callback)
        Constructs a MLObject whose id is already known by fetching data from the server in a background thread. This does not use caching. This is preferable to using the MLObject(className, objectId) constructor, unless your code is already running in a background thread.
        Type Parameters:
        T - a class extends MLObject
        Parameters:
        className - The class of object to create.
        objectId - Object id of the MLObject to fetch.
        callback - callback.done(object, e) will be called when the fetch completes.
